DOC:
Subject: Canada 5-0 after preliminary round at World Champioships News-Software: VAX/VMS VNEWS 1.41 Date: Mon, 26 Apr 1993 19:53:00 GMT Lines: 17
Team Canada defeated Russia 3-1 to finish the priliminary round unbeaten at 5-0. Scoring for the Canadians were Kevin Dineen of the Flyers, Eric Lindros also of the Flyers and Paul Cariya of the Maine Black Bears. Cariya has put on quite a show at the Worlds. He is sure to be drafted in the top 3 this summer at the NHL entry draft.
Canada defeated Italy 11-2 and Austria 11-0 before meeting the Russians on Sunday. The Canadians now face Finland in the Quarter - finals on Tuesday.
Kevin White white@cc.hollandc.pe.ca Holland College Ch'town PEI Canada
